questions.question: Take the number of words in the motto of Massachusetts, multiply by the number implied in the abbreviation t.i.d., subtract the number of “i”s in the motto of the University of Florida, and divide by the number of words in the motto of Amherst College. What do you get?

Take the number of words in the motto of the University of Vermont, add the number of words in the motto of the city of London, multiply by the number of words in the motto of Kansas, add the number of words in the motto of the University of Missouri, and divide by the number of letters in the abbreviation which means “rest in peace”.
